page.title: 19 FARMING ( PAGE 2 )
page.content: Still on church land are{North Lees } {Grange}and{Wood Farm. } Wheat and barley are grown as the main crop, some of which is sold for cereals the rest being kept for feeding. A small acreage of root crops are grown, for example swedes and mangolds which also help with feeding. The stock consists of dairy cows and bullocks for fattening. The main breeds are Herefords, Fresians and Charolais. These two farms are fitted with modern milking equipment. All the farms in this area possess up to date machinery including combined harvesters, tractors, hay machines and bailers.
